summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to defense attorney Gerald Lefcourt, attaching the U.S. Attorney's Office's written counterproposal regarding a non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein. It references a prior discussion between Lefcourt and U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta.

persons.name: Gerald Lefcourt
persons.context: Recipient of the email and attachment regarding the non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein. The email references his prior discussion with U.S. Attorney Acosta.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Mentioned as having had a discussion with Gerald Lefcourt regarding the non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the attached non-prosecution agreement counterproposal from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Lefcourt is the defense attorney receiving the counterproposal for a non-prosecution agreement on behalf of Epstein.
Had a discussion prior to this email regarding the terms of Epstein's non-prosecution agreement.
As U.S. Attorney, Acosta's office is proposing a non-prosecution agreement for Epstein.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Counterproposal Sent
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails defense attorney Gerald Lefcourt, attaching the U.S. Attorney's Office's written counterproposal for a non-prosecution agreement regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: On September 10, 2007, the U.S. Attorney's Office sent a written counterproposal for a non-prosecution agreement regarding Jeffrey Epstein to his defense attorney, Gerald Lefcourt.
The email references a prior discussion between Lefcourt and U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta about the agreement.
The attachment is specifically named '070910_Epstein_Non-Prosecution_Agreement.pdf', indicating the date and subject.
